dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Millions of Americans, 1.35 million to be exact, filed for unemployment last week.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Millions of Americans, one point three five million to be exact, filed for unemployment last week.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Stocks fell after jobless claims data came in slightly worse than expected, with 1.3 million more Americans filing for unemployment in the week ending July 11, according to the Labor Department.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and that's slightly worse than expected, right? The jobless claims data really set the tone for Friday's open.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and that's slightly worse than expected, right? The jobless claims data really set the tone for Friday's open.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The market opened lower on Thursday, with more big banks reporting second quarter earnings, as investors grappled with the latest economic data showing the economic fallout from the coronavirus pandemic.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It did. The Dow was down over 150 points at the open, and the S&P and Nasdaq both fell too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It did. The Dow was down over one hundred fifty points at the open, and the S&P and Nasdaq both fell too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Dow Jones Industrial Average was down 0.6%, over 150 points, at Thursdays open, while the S&P 500 fell 0.6% and the tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite lost 0.9%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But then you've got retail sales jumping 7.6% in June—that's actually higher than forecast.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then you've got retail sales jumping seven point six percent in June-that's actually higher than forecast.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Retail sales jumped by 7.5% in Junehigher than the 5.2% expected, but lower than last months record surge of 17.7%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: True, but it's still way lower than May's huge 17.7% surge. So it's a mixed bag, really.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, but it's still way lower than May's huge seventeen point seven percent surge. So it's a mixed bag, really.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Retail sales jumped by 7.5% in Junehigher than the 5.2% expected, but lower than last months record surge of 17.7%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And the banks are reporting... Bank of America topped estimates but still fell almost 4%.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the banks are reporting... Bank of America topped estimates but still fell almost four percent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Major banks, meanwhile, continued to kick off second quarter earnings season: Bank of America topped estimates but its stock fell nearly 4% as the company set aside $4 billion for coronavirus-related losses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, because they set aside $4.2 billion for potential pandemic losses. That spooked investors a bit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, because they set aside four point two dollars billion for potential pandemic losses. That spooked investors a bit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Major banks, meanwhile, continued to kick off second quarter earnings season: Bank of America topped estimates but its stock fell nearly 4% as the company set aside $4 billion for coronavirus-related losses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, Morgan Stanley shares actually rose almost 1% after crushing expectations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, Morgan Stanley shares actually rose almost one percent after crushing expectations.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Morgan Stanley shares rose by almost 1% after the bank easily beat analyst expectations thanks to surging trading revenueswith its revenue from fixed income traders increasing by 170% last quarter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, uh, their fixed income trading revenue was up a massive 170% last quarter.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, uh, their fixed income trading revenue was up a massive one hundred seventy percent last quarter.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Morgan Stanley shares rose by almost 1% after the bank easily beat analyst expectations thanks to surging trading revenueswith its revenue from fixed income traders increasing by 170% last quarter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And then there's Twitter—down more than 3% after that huge hack.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there's Twitter-down more than three percent after that huge hack.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shares of social media platform Twitter dropped more than 3% following a massive digital currency scam late on Wednesday: Hackers gained access to dozens of high-profile accounts, including Tesla CEO Elon Musk, former vice president Joe Biden and Microsoft cofounder Bill Gates.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Oh right, the one with Elon Musk, Obama, and Bill Gates' accounts compromised. That's a nightmare.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh right, the one with Elon Musk, Obama, and Bill Gates' accounts compromised. That's a nightmare.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hackers gained access to dozens of high-profile accounts, including Tesla CEO Elon Musk, former vice president Joe Biden and Microsoft cofounder Bill Gates.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's wild—just a day earlier, stocks were rallying on vaccine news from Moderna.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's wild-just a day earlier, stocks were rallying on vaccine news from Moderna.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On Wednesday, stocks rallied on positive coronavirus vaccine news from Moderna and strong earnings results from Goldman Sachs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but then new COVID cases hit a record this week, over 67,000 in a single day. So much uncertainty.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but then new COVID cases hit a record this week, over sixty seven thousand in a single day. So much uncertainty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But recent gains come amid a backdrop of surging coronavirus infections across the country, however: The U.S. reported a new daily record of more than 67,000 cases earlier this week.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It feels like the market is just reacting to every single headline, good or bad.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It feels like the market is just reacting to every single headline, good or bad.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. One day up, next day down—it's exhausting for investors trying to find a trend.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. One day up, next day down-it's exhausting for investors trying to find a trend.

artist_script:
Millions of Americans, 1.35 million to be exact, filed for unemployment last week.
HostB: Yeah, and that's slightly worse than expected, right? The jobless claims data really set the tone for Friday's open.
HostA: It did. The Dow was down over 150 points at the open, and the S&P and Nasdaq both fell too.
HostB: But then you've got retail sales jumping 7.6% in June—that's actually higher than forecast.
HostA: True, but it's still way lower than May's huge 17.7% surge. So it's a mixed bag, really.
HostB: And the banks are reporting... Bank of America topped estimates but still fell almost 4%.
HostA: Right, because they set aside $4.2 billion for potential pandemic losses. That spooked investors a bit.
HostB: Meanwhile, Morgan Stanley shares actually rose almost 1% after crushing expectations.
HostA: Yeah, uh, their fixed income trading revenue was up a massive 170% last quarter.
HostB: And then there's Twitter—down more than 3% after that huge hack.
HostA: Oh right, the one with Elon Musk, Obama, and Bill Gates' accounts compromised. That’s a nightmare.
HostB: It's wild—just a day earlier, stocks were rallying on vaccine news from Moderna.
HostA: Yeah, but then new COVID cases hit a record this week, over 67,000 in a single day. So much uncertainty.
HostB: It feels like the market is just reacting to every single headline, good or bad.
HostA: Exactly. One day up, next day down—it’s exhausting for investors trying to find a trend.
